ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A wide range of the fundamental principles in ecological systems demonstrated by the real lifestyles of model organisms from unicellular to all phyla of plants and animals.
A lot of good info about various forms of life. Good lab techniques in dissection
I think this course was a good introduction to understanding evolutionary biology. It was also a good course for developing lab skills.
Really good intro to evolutionary biology
I learned a lot about insects, fish, and plants.
I learned how to write lab reports and observe how adaptations in animals in plants allow them to survive and thrive in their ecological niches.
Trees, flowers, fishes, tree of life info

I learned how to apply my knowledge about currently living organisms to make inferences about their ecological and evolutionary characteristics. This will help me further understand the importance of biodiversity within the current world.
I learned how to absorb lots of information about a subject I came in with little to no knowledge of.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strengths: Very descriptive and broadly informative lab handouts, great variety of subject matter and activities.
More organization needed and better clarity on what information will be tested on. Professor and TAs are awesome and very passionate. Class is geared towards learning
Overall, this course was very good. The only issue was the delay in grading the assignments.
Nature walk was an excellent project that I felt really satisfied with. Honestly most of the labs were pretty fun (which is impressive bc lab courses at Yale are rarely fun)
I think that long lab reports and short lab reports should be more evenly spaced out rather than having consecutive weeks of long reports.

Strengths:
- lab time was fun and very hands on
- mini lab reports were manageable to get done
Weaknesses:
- did not get grades back. even at the end of the semester, there were many lab reports ungraded, so we had no feedback
- workload was heavy and quizzes felt unreasonable at some points.
Pretty fun and interactive but the formal reports were often tedious and overly long

The strengths of the course are the professor and teaching team. They are very helpful and willing to explain course content to you if you are confused. One way to improve the course would be to make the laboratory handout instructions a little bit clearer and possibly shorter as it is difficult to complete the entire content in the allotted lab time period sometimes. However, this course was still excellent!
This course was very interesting however the classroom time overages gave additional stress for students who had commitments following the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: One of the most fun labs with the greatest variety of subject material and hands-on activities that can be found at Yale.
Yes, good lab for premed lab requirement. Prof Wells is really nice. Be prepared to study a lot for weekly quizzes
Yes this was a really excellent class with a wonderful professor

Yes!!! The course is very engaging. Although its a bit stressful to study for quizzes and time-consuming to do the lab reports, the lab itself of very fun. You get to go to the botanical gardens, wade in the river, and examine a lot of live organisms. Highly recommend, especially if you need a pre-med lab.

I maybe would. It does have the workload of a regular 1 credit course, which is something to take into account with scheduling. You can succeed if you have the time to put in, but it is more work than I anticipated for a 0.5 credit class.

Yes, a fun bio lab. Marta is so passionate and wonderful. I enjoyed the labs more often than not, but the formal reports were often overly tedious and long. I didnt receive much feedback throughout the semester for reports, so even evaluating this class, I am not sure what my grade is. But overall, enjoyable to take during my last semester at Yale

I would recommend this course to another student as the professors and TAs are very kind and understanding. The content is very interesting and you can learn about a diverse set of information. Overall, the quizzes and assignments are fair, but the workload is a bit high. However, this course is still amazing and one of the least stressful lab courses I have been in, which really allowed me to enjoy the content we were learning.
I enjoyed this course however the lab reports do take a significant amount of time.
